result.execSummary:
The defendant Roderick O Moore was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Felon Possess Firearm [Modifiers: Repeater], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Restitution set at zero.
MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges; to include the victim/witness surcharges, are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid by 12/5/2020; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge; to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid by 12/5/2020; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.
Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification Program.

AODA assessment and any recommended treatment.
Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Roderick O Moore in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Roderick O Moore in custody.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Sentencing Proceeded. Statements by the State, defense counsel and defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1
The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 5 YEARS and 6 MONTHS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 2 YEARS and 6 MONTHS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 3 YEARS, consecutive to any other sentence.

Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
-Restitution set at zero
-MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges; to include the victim/witness surcharges, are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid by 12/5/2020; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge; to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid by 12/5/2020; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers
-Employment or school
-Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification Program
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.


Filed, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Filed, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement
Order To Produce Transport

Defendant Roderick O Moore in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Roderick O Moore in custody.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
  At the hour of 1:40 pm the jury returned and, by their foreperson, brought in a verdict of GUILTY which was then read.  Court polled and discharged the jury.  Verdict received and filed.  Court granted state's motion for judgment on the verdict and denied defense motion for judgment not withstanding the verdict.  Court ordered entry of judgment of conviction. Court finds that the State has established the "Repeater" enhancer. Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored. Case calendared for SENTENCING on 6/5/2015 at 1:30 pm in Branch 15.

Defendant Roderick O Moore in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Roderick O Moore in custody.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Jury in the box: 8:48 am. Sworn for the State: Officer Mark Dillman, Print Examiner Richard Jacobs. State rests subject to rebuttal. Jury out of the box: 9:48 am. Defense motion to dismiss at close of state's case denied by the court.  Jury in the box: 10:55 am. Defense rests.  State and defense rest.  Testimony closed.   Court instructed jury.  Closing arguments by state and defense.  Court charged the jury.  Alternate juror selected by lot and released.  Jury retired at the hour of 11:58 pm to deliberate in the charge of Sheriff's Deputies R. Crespo and R. Hoffman who were duly sworn for that purpose.

Jurors in box at 1:58 pm and sworn.  Court instructed jury.  Opening statements by state and defense.  Trial continued.  Sworn for the state:  Debra K., Milwaukee Police Officer Sean Mahnke, Milwaukee Police Officer Mark Dillman,  Exhibit  1, 16, 17, 3-14, 2, 15, 19, 20,  received.  Jury out of box at 4:47 pm.  Court recessed for the day.

Defendant Roderick O Moore in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Roderick O Moore in custody.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  AA.  

Jury panel in court. Voir dire proceeded at the hour of 10:04 am.  Jury out of box at 11:35 am.  Jury in box at 11:46 am.  Thirteen (13) good and lawful citizens of the County of Milwaukee, WI qualified to serve as jurors in the above entitled cause were duly impanelled.  Jury list received and filed.  Jury out of box at 12:01 pm.  Court recessed for lunch.

Defendant Roderick O Moore in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Roderick O Moore in custody.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB

for jury trial on 10/22/14 in Branch 15.

Defendant Roderick O Moore in court with attorney Richard J. Johnson.  Defendant Roderick O Moore in custody.  Karyn Behling for Kevin R. Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Mark Dillman-MPD Officer.  Court took judical notice of certified documents regarding case #12CF5413 that are attached to the complaint.    State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 16, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION INCLUDING DRUG TESTING.

Defendant Roderick O Moore in court with attorney Debra J. Patterson.  Defendant Roderick O Moore in custody.  Carole R. Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge KONKOL, Branch 44.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 4, 2014 at 08:30 am.
